stimulusHtml: A yearbook company was investigating whether there is a significant difference between two states in the percents of high school students who order yearbooks. From a random sample of 150 students selected from one state, 70 had ordered a yearbook. From a random sample of 100 students selected from the other state, 65 had ordered a yearbook. Which of the following is the most appropriate method for analyzing the results?
choicesHtml: A one-sample z-test for a sample proportion
A one-sample z-test for a population proportion
A two-sample z-test for a difference in sample proportions
A two-sample z-test for a difference in population proportions
A two-sample z-test for a population proportion
